bibl.title: Letter from Harry M. Carroll to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 9, 1926

div1.p: Carroll informs Emilie Lawrence Reed that the Medical Society of Virginia will address his proposal to make Walter Reed's birthplace a national shrine.

div1.head: Letter from Harry M. Carroll to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 9, 1926
div1.opener:
Harry M. Carroll
Lawyer
Donna, Texas
May 9, 1926.
Mrs. Emilie L. Reed,
Blue Ridge Summit,
Pennsylvania.
Dear Madam:-
div1.p:
You may be interested to know, that I am in receipt
of a communication from Dr. John Joseph Nutt, address, The Wyoming,
55th Street and Seventh Avenue, New York, N. Y., advising me
that the Medical Society of the State of Virginia, have taken
up the question of my appeal.

I have requested Dr. Nutt, to advise me from time
to time as to the action taken by the Virginia Medical Society,
and if I receive favorable and interesting news, I will be more
than glad to forward such information and data to your address.
